001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.service.tables;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.base.TableComponentType;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
005import java.util.function.Consumer;
006
007/**
008 * Represents a table element that can be interacted with in the UI.
009 *
010 * <p>This interface provides methods for retrieving table metadata, such as
011 * its type, row representation class, and lifecycle hooks (before and after actions).
012 *
013 * <p>Implementations of this interface are used to define specific tables
014 * and their associated behaviors within the test automation framework.
015 *
016 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
017 */
018public interface TableElement<K extends Enum<K>> {
019
020   /**
021    * Retrieves the table type for the implementing table.
022    *
023    * <p>By default, this method returns {@link DefaultTableTypes#DEFAULT}.
024    * Implementations may override this method to provide a custom table type.
025    *
026    * @param <T> The type of {@link TableComponentType}.
027    * @return The table type associated with this table element.
028    */
029   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
030   default <T extends TableComponentType> T tableType() {
031      return (T) DefaultTableTypes.DEFAULT;
032   }
033
034   /**
035    * Retrieves the class representing the rows of the table.
036    *
037    * @param <T> The type of the row representation class.
038    * @return The {@link Class} representing the table rows.
039    */
040   <T> Class<T> rowsRepresentationClass();
041
042   /**
043    * Retrieves the enumeration instance representing this table element.
044    *
045    * @return An {@link Enum} instance associated with this table element.
046    */
047   K enumImpl();
048
049   /**
050    * Provides a before-action hook that is executed before interacting with the table.
051    *
052    * <p>This method allows implementations to define preconditions,
053    * such as waiting for the table to load.
054    *
055    * @return A {@link Consumer} accepting {@link SmartWebDriver} for executing preconditions.
056    */
057   default Consumer<SmartWebDriver> before() {
058      return smartWebDriver -> {
059      };
060   }
061
062   /**
063    * Provides an after-action hook that is executed after interacting with the table.
064    *
065    * <p>This method allows implementations to define post-interaction actions,
066    * such as logging interactions or refreshing the UI state.
067    *
068    * @return A {@link Consumer} accepting {@link SmartWebDriver} for executing postconditions.
069    */
070   default Consumer<SmartWebDriver> after() {
071      return smartWebDriver -> {
072      };
073   }
074
075}
